newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: WA Premier wants Canberra meeting to examine fiscal issues.
newsitem.headline: WA Premier wants Canberra meeting to examine fiscal issues.

text.p: The terms of reference of the national government's constitutional convention should be expanded to include Commonwealth-State financial relations, said the Premier of the state of Western Australia, Richard Court.

"I believe it would be for the good of the nation if we looked at issues such as the Commonwealth-State financial arrangements. I find it ludicrous that the states deliver most of the services yet have to get a large amount of their funding cap-in-hand from Canberra," Court said on his weekly talkback radio session.
The planned Constitutional Convention, due to take place over 10 days in December, will discuss whether Australia should become a republic.
Court's comments followed his release on Monday of WA Treasury figures showing that Western Australians pay a total of A$1.533 billion more annually in federal taxes than they get back in services.
